Detailed Description

template<class ElementT, typename Notifier = SelectableSelector>
class PointerFifoTemplate< ElementT, Notifier >

An implementation of a queue that uses the first-in-first-out algorithm.

The methods are protected with a monitor to make them safe. The template uses pointers to the specified class to be able to return NULL.

Definition at line 178 of file PointerFifoTemplate.h.

template<class ElementT, typename Notifier = SelectableSelector>
ElementT* PointerFifoTemplate< ElementT, Notifier >::dequeue (   )  [inline]
 

Get one element from the queue.

If the queue is empty this method will hang until there is a packet to return or until the queue is woken up. In that case NULL can be returned.

Returns:
One element in the queue.

Definition at line 158 of file PointerFifoTemplate.h.

Referenced by PointerFifoTemplate< RunnableType >::dequeue().

template<class ElementT, typename Notifier = SelectableSelector>
ElementT* PointerFifoTemplate< ElementT, Notifier >::dequeue (  uint32  maxWaitTime  )  [inline]
 

Get one packet from the queue.

If the queue is empty this method will hang until there is a packet to return, but maximum maxWaitTime. If the timeout is reached or if terminate() is called, NULL is returned.

Parameters:
maxWaitTime The maximum time to wait for packets in the queue. In milliseconds.
Returns:
One packet in the queue.

Definition at line 120 of file PointerFifoTemplate.h.

template<class ElementT, typename Notifier = SelectableSelector>
ElementT* PointerFifoTemplate< ElementT, Notifier >::dequeueNonBlocking (   )  [inline]
 

Get one element from the queue.

If the queue is empty NULL will be returned.

Returns:
One element from the queue or NULL if the queue is empty.

Insert one element into the queue.

The is not copied, so it must not be deleted by the caller.
